intro: Erigeron muelleri, commonly known as Mueller's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender stems and hairy leaves, with small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in grassy areas and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
